title: Emperor Xian of Han abdicates the throne to Cao Pi ending the Han dynasty and establish the Kingdom of Wei
text: Emperor Xian of Han abdicates the throne to Cao Pi ending the Han dynasty and establish the Kingdom of Wei

title: The son of Empress Zoë of Byzantium succeeds to the throne of the Eastern Roman Empire as Michael V.
text: The son of Empress Zoë of Byzantium succeeds to the throne of the Eastern Roman Empire as Michael V.

title: The "Nyköping Banquet" - King Birger of Sweden treacherously seizes his two brothers Valdemar, Duke of Finland and Eric, Duke of Södermanland, who were subsequently starved to death in the dungeon of Nyköping Castle.
text: The "Nyköping Banquet" - King Birger of Sweden treacherously seizes his two brothers Valdemar, Duke of Finland and Eric, Duke of Södermanland, who were subsequently starved to death in the dungeon of Nyköping Castle.

title: The League of Cambrai is formed by Pope Julius II, Louis XII of France, Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor and Ferdinand II of Aragon as an alliance against Venice.
text: The League of Cambrai is formed by Pope Julius II, Louis XII of France, Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor and Ferdinand II of Aragon as an alliance against Venice.

title: Martin Luther burns his copy of the papal bull Exsurge Domine outside Wittenberg's Elster Gate.
text: Martin Luther burns his copy of the papal bull Exsurge Domine outside Wittenberg's Elster Gate.

title: Thomas Culpeper and Francis Dereham are executed for having affairs with Catherine Howard, Queen of England and wife of Henry VIII.
text: Thomas Culpeper and Francis Dereham are executed for having affairs with Catherine Howard, Queen of England and wife of Henry VIII.

title: Defeat at the Battle of Dungeness causes the Commonwealth of England to reform its navy.
text: Defeat at the Battle of Dungeness causes the Commonwealth of England to reform its navy.

title: The Royal Netherlands Marine Corps is founded by Michiel de Ruyter
text: The Royal Netherlands Marine Corps is founded by Michiel de Ruyter

title: Isaac Newton's derivation of Kepler's laws from his theory of gravity, contained in the paper De motu corporum in gyrum, is read to the Royal Society by Edmond Halley.
text: Isaac Newton's derivation of Kepler's laws from his theory of gravity, contained in the paper De motu corporum in gyrum, is read to the Royal Society by Edmond Halley.

title: France adopts the metre as its official unit of length.
text: France adopts the metre as its official unit of length.

title: Mississippi becomes the 20th U.S. state.
text: Mississippi becomes the 20th U.S. state.

title: American Civil War: The Confederate States of America accept a rival state government's pronouncement that declares Kentucky to be the 13th state of the Confederacy.
text: American Civil War: The Confederate States of America accept a rival state government's pronouncement that declares Kentucky to be the 13th state of the Confederacy.

title: Forces led by Nguyễn Trung Trực, an anti-colonial guerrilla leader in southern Vietnam, sink the French lorcha L'Esperance.
text: Forces led by Nguyễn Trung Trực, an anti-colonial guerrilla leader in southern Vietnam, sink the French lorcha L'Esperance.

title: American Civil War: Sherman's March to the Sea: Major General William Tecumseh Sherman's Union Army troops reach the outer Confederate defenses of Savannah, Georgia.
text: American Civil War: Sherman's March to the Sea: Major General William Tecumseh Sherman's Union Army troops reach the outer Confederate defenses of Savannah, Georgia.

title: The first traffic lights are installed, outside the Palace of Westminster in London. Resembling railway signals, they use semaphore arms and are illuminated at night by red and green gas lamps.
text: The first traffic lights are installed, outside the Palace of Westminster in London. Resembling railway signals, they use semaphore arms and are illuminated at night by red and green gas lamps.

title: Russo-Turkish War: The Russian Army captures Plevna after a 5-month siege. The garrison of 25,000 surviving Turks surrenders. The Russian victory is decisive for the outcome of the war and the Liberation of Bulgaria.
text: Russo-Turkish War: The Russian Army captures Plevna after a 5-month siege. The garrison of 25,000 surviving Turks surrenders. The Russian victory is decisive for the outcome of the war and the Liberation of Bulgaria.

title: Mark Twain's Adventures of Huckleberry Finn is published.
text: Mark Twain's Adventures of Huckleberry Finn is published.

title: Alfred Jarry's Ubu Roi premieres in Paris. A riot breaks out at the end of the performance.
text: Alfred Jarry's Ubu Roi premieres in Paris. A riot breaks out at the end of the performance.

title: Spanish–American War: The Treaty of Paris is signed, officially ending the conflict.
text: Spanish–American War: The Treaty of Paris is signed, officially ending the conflict.

title: The first Nobel Prize ceremony is held in Stockholm on the fifth anniversary of Alfred Nobel's death.
text: The first Nobel Prize ceremony is held in Stockholm on the fifth anniversary of Alfred Nobel's death.

title: The opening of the reservoir of the Aswan Dam in Egypt.
text: The opening of the reservoir of the Aswan Dam in Egypt.

title: U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt wins the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in the mediation of the Russo-Japanese War, becoming the first American to win a Nobel Prize.
text: U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt wins the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in the mediation of the Russo-Japanese War, becoming the first American to win a Nobel Prize.

title: The worst night of the Brown Dog riots in London, when 1,000 medical students clash with 400 police officers over the existence of a memorial for animals that have been vivisected.
text: The worst night of the Brown Dog riots in London, when 1,000 medical students clash with 400 police officers over the existence of a memorial for animals that have been vivisected.

title: Selma Lagerlöf becomes the first female writer to win the Nobel Prize in Literature
text: Selma Lagerlöf becomes the first female writer to win the Nobel Prize in Literature

title: Thailand becomes a constitutional monarchy.
text: Thailand becomes a constitutional monarchy.

title: Abdication Crisis: Edward VIII signs the Instrument of Abdication.
text: Abdication Crisis: Edward VIII signs the Instrument of Abdication.

title: World War II: The Royal Navy capital ships HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse are sunk by Imperial Japanese Navy torpedo bombers near British Malaya.
text: World War II: The Royal Navy capital ships HMS Prince of Wales and HMS Repulse are sunk by Imperial Japanese Navy torpedo bombers near British Malaya.

title: World War II: Battle of the Philippines: Imperial Japanese forces under the command of General Masaharu Homma land on Luzon.
text: World War II: Battle of the Philippines: Imperial Japanese forces under the command of General Masaharu Homma land on Luzon.

title: The Human Rights Convention is signed by the United Nations.
text: The Human Rights Convention is signed by the United Nations.

title: Chinese Civil War: The People's Liberation Army begins its siege of Chengdu, the last Kuomintang-held city in mainland China, forcing President of the Republic of China Chiang Kai-shek and his government to retreat to Taiwan.
text: Chinese Civil War: The People's Liberation Army begins its siege of Chengdu, the last Kuomintang-held city in mainland China, forcing President of the Republic of China Chiang Kai-shek and his government to retreat to Taiwan.

title: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill receives the Nobel Prize in literature.
text: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill receives the Nobel Prize in literature.

title: Zanzibar gains independence from the United Kingdom as a constitutional monarchy, under Sultan Jamshid bin Abdullah.
text: Zanzibar gains independence from the United Kingdom as a constitutional monarchy, under Sultan Jamshid bin Abdullah.

title: An assassination attempt on the British High Commissioner in Aden kills two people and wounds dozens more.
text: An assassination attempt on the British High Commissioner in Aden kills two people and wounds dozens more.

title: Japan's biggest heist, the still-unsolved "300 million yen robbery", is carried out in Tokyo.
text: Japan's biggest heist, the still-unsolved "300 million yen robbery", is carried out in Tokyo.

title: Arab–Israeli conflict: Prime Minister of Israel Menachem Begin and President of Egypt Anwar Sadat are jointly awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
text: Arab–Israeli conflict: Prime Minister of Israel Menachem Begin and President of Egypt Anwar Sadat are jointly awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Kaohsiung Incident: Taiwanese pro-democracy demonstrations are suppressed by the KMT dictatorship, and organizers are arrested.
text: Kaohsiung Incident: Taiwanese pro-democracy demonstrations are suppressed by the KMT dictatorship, and organizers are arrested.

title: Democracy is restored in Argentina with the inauguration of President Raúl Alfonsín.
text: Democracy is restored in Argentina with the inauguration of President Raúl Alfonsín.

title: United Nations General Assembly recognizes the Convention against Torture.
text: United Nations General Assembly recognizes the Convention against Torture.

title: Mongolian Revolution: At the country's first open pro-democracy public demonstration, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj announces the establishment of the Mongolian Democratic Union.
text: Mongolian Revolution: At the country's first open pro-democracy public demonstration, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj announces the establishment of the Mongolian Democratic Union.

title: The last shift leaves Wearmouth Colliery in Sunderland. The closure of the 156-year-old pit marks the end of the old County Durham coalfield, which had been in operation since the Middle Ages.
text: The last shift leaves Wearmouth Colliery in Sunderland. The closure of the 156-year-old pit marks the end of the old County Durham coalfield, which had been in operation since the Middle Ages.

title: Rwandan genocide: Maurice Baril, military advisor to the U.N. Secretary-General and head of the Military Division of the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, recommends that UNAMIR stand down.
text: Rwandan genocide: Maurice Baril, military advisor to the U.N. Secretary-General and head of the Military Division of the Department of Peacekeeping Operations, recommends that UNAMIR stand down.

title: The Israeli army withdraws from Nablus pursuant to the terms of Oslo Accord.
text: The Israeli army withdraws from Nablus pursuant to the terms of Oslo Accord.

title: The new Constitution of South Africa is promulgated by Nelson Mandela.
text: The new Constitution of South Africa is promulgated by Nelson Mandela.

title: Palestinian minister Ziad Abu Ein was killed after the suppression of a demonstration by Israeli forces in the village (Turmus'ayya) in Ramallah.
text: Palestinian minister Ziad Abu Ein was killed after the suppression of a demonstration by Israeli forces in the village (Turmus'ayya) in Ramallah.

title: Two explosions outside a football stadium in Istanbul, Turkey, kill 38 people and injure 166 others.
